title: Technical Manager Job at FGS Limited
content:
FGS Limited, an Oil and Gas company, is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Technical Manager
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Oil & Gas and Energy

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To collaborate as a support to the MD in designing and implementing a 1–5-year growth strategies for EPCIM services.
	To support end-to-end EPCIM project execution; alignment between engineering design, procurement, construction, installation, and maintenance phases in compliance with ISO 9001/14001/45001 standards.
	Develop integrated project execution plans (PEPs) using Primavera/MS Project, emphasizing phase gate reviews and risk mitigation.
	Collaborate with engineering teams to validate designs against client specifications (e.g., ASME, ANSI) and operational feasibility. To support procurement by reviewing technical datasheets, material specifications, and vendor qualifications for mechanical- rotating equipment (pumps, compressors).
	Ensure procurement aligns with EPCIM timelines, minimizing lead times and cost overruns while complying with QA/QC protocols.
	Manage on-site construction/installation, ensuring adherence to IFC drawings, P&IDs, and HSE protocols (NEBOSH/ISO 45001).
	Resolve technical clashes during commissioning and startup phases.
	Implement predictive maintenance programs (vibration analysis, thermography) for mechanical-rotating assets to reduce downtime.
	Develop SOPs for maintenance workflows at the workshop and running projects, while integrating lessons learned from any EPC phases into lifecycle management as maybe applicable
	Lead tender processes, including risk assessments, cost estimation, and proposal development, ensuring EPCIM scope clarity and competitive pricing for a 95% success rate.
	Drive OEM product sales by presenting the company technical capabilities to prospective clients.
	Continuous vetting of all bid/tendering documents to ensure they meet technical, commercial and documentation expectations that must pass all metrics for measuring a successful bid/tender
	Achieve a minimum 50% bid win rate through competitive pricing and technical differentiation
	Procurement & Supply Chain Integration
	Construction & Installation Management
	Maintenance & Reliability Optimization
	Tendering & Business Development


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering,
	(Masters degree in Project Management or Engineering Management is a plus.)
	Minimum of 15 - 20 years’ experience as Maintenance Manager, Engineering Manager or Technical Manager in the oil and gas or energy sector.
	Must be NSE or COREN certified


Key Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and commercial awareness
	Strong industry network and client engagement skills
	Technical understanding of energy products and services
	Goal-oriented and highly motivated
	Strong Leadership and interpersonal relationship
	Strong project management skill
	Strong negotiation skill
	Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV in PDF to: robertituboala@gmail.com or: info@fleesglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Executive Assistant (with Legal Background) Job at Limeswood International Company Limited
content:
Limeswood International Company Limited, situated in Nigeria, stands as a respected entity specializing in Mechanical, Electrical, and Instrumentation services. As dedicated partners, we cater to a wide array of industries, particularly focusing on oil and gas, power, energy, petrochemicals, and manufacturing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant (with Legal Background)
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Monday - Friday)

Position Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking an organized, professional, and proactive Executive Assistant with a legal background to support our senior leadership team.
	This position involves a mix of administrative duties and legal support, assisting in the smooth operation of the executive office while ensuring that all legal matters are handled appropriately.


Key Responsibilities
Executive Support:


	Manage the daily schedule, appointments, and meetings for senior leadership, ensuring efficient time management.
	Serve as the primary point of contact between executives and both internal and external stakeholders.
	Organize and prioritize incoming correspondence, emails, and phone calls, responding on behalf of executives when necessary.
	Prepare reports, presentations, and other business materials for meetings and conferences.
	Make travel arrangements, including flight bookings, accommodations, and itineraries for the executive team.
	Handle personal tasks and errands for executives as needed.


Legal Support and Administration:


	Assist in drafting, reviewing, and editing legal documents (contracts, agreements, non-disclosure agreements, etc.).
	Conduct legal research and provide summaries of relevant laws, regulations, and precedents.
	Maintain and organize legal files and documentation in compliance with confidentiality and privacy standards.
	Ensure the timely submission of legal documents and correspondence, tracking important deadlines.
	Coordinate with external legal counsel as required, keeping executives informed of progress and developments.


Office Management:


	Manage administrative functions for the executive office, including file management, office supplies, and office logistics.
	Organize and schedule meetings, ensuring all necessary documents and information are available.
	Monitor the progress of ongoing legal and administrative projects, providing regular updates to senior leadership.
	Assist with the coordination of company events, conferences, and internal meetings, ensuring all details are managed effectively.
	Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive company and legal information with discretion.


Qualifications


	A Bachelor’s degree in Law
	Proven experience as an Executive Assistant, Personal Assistant, or similar role, preferably in a legal or corporate environment.
	In-depth knowledge of legal terminology, legal documents, and processes.
	Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), legal software, and project management tools.
	Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and maintain confidentiality.
	Flexible to travel
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate professionally with stakeholders at all levels.
	High attention to detail and accuracy in document management and preparation.
	Proximity to the Island is a plus
	Flexible, adaptable, and able to handle a variety of tasks in a fast-paced environment.
